intro: Reynosia guama, commonly known as the Mexican mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as oaks and pines. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Reynosia guama plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
